title: Enel as False God vs True Deity
theoryText: The episode raises questions about whether Enel is genuinely divine or merely an impostor with Devil Fruit powers. The varied reactions of the Straw Hats (Chopper's belief, Zoro's indifference, Sanji's skepticism, Luffy's defiance) mirror fan discussions about the nature of godhood in One Piece's world.
author: neverwatchedonepiece (Tumblr)

title: Skypiea's Long-term Importance to the Series
theoryText: Despite being considered skippable by some fans, the Skypiea Arc introduces crucial worldbuilding elements that become important later in the series. The introduction of Enel's power, the concept of Vearth, and the conflict over sacred land all have parallels and callbacks in future arcs.
author: Multiple fans (ResetEra, One Piece Podcast)

title: The Three-Way Conflict Structure
theoryText: Episode 155 sets up a complex three-way conflict: Enel's tyrannical rule, the Shandia's rightful claim to their homeland, and the Straw Hats' accidental involvement. This structure mirrors real-world conflicts over colonization and indigenous rights, suggesting deeper themes in the arc.
author: Various analysts
